item.description: One of my favourite newsletters, Remarkables List by @capuletcomms, sent out the 300th edition today. To celebrate, you should visit https://t.co/cnVG3zkFxn and hit the “Get Inbox Inspiration” button to subscribe.

item.description:
Extremely short videos are way better than static photos. So much more interesting. https://t.co/2QTeslytWu

“I mean, photopgraphy is all right if you don’t mind looking at the word from the point of view of a paralyzed Cyclops—for a split second. But that’s not what it’s like to live in the world.” https://t.co/WBAg2598tG
item.source:markdown:
Extremely short videos are way better than static photos. So much more interesting. https://t.co/2QTeslytWu
“I mean, photopgraphy is all right if you don’t mind looking at the word from the point of view of a paralyzed Cyclops—for a split second. But that’s not what it’s like to live in the world.” https://t.co/WBAg2598tG

item.description: This is the thunderstorm that we paid our property taxes for. #dlws
item.source:markdown: This is the thunderstorm that we paid our property taxes for. #dlws

item.description:
I enjoyed this podcast from @TalkingDrupal about the Book Module. It’s one of my favourite modules, and I use it extensively on my Drupal 7 site. It should probably be called the Outline module, since you can then use Drupal as a content outliner. #drupal https://t.co/Iklbp4tWeG

Turning content into a “book” may have been the module’s original function, but the outline part of it service a more general purpose.

They talk about an outline not being able to have more than one parent, but I do recall it being possible by adding a reference in the database, even if there’s no UI for it (maybe not in the post-Drupal 8 incarnation of the software, but definitely in a previous version).
item.source:markdown:
I enjoyed this podcast from @TalkingDrupal about the Book Module. It’s one of my favourite modules, and I use it extensively on my Drupal 7 site. It should probably be called the Outline module, since you can then use Drupal as a content outliner. #drupal https://t.co/Iklbp4tWeG
Turning content into a “book” may have been the module’s original function, but the outline part of it service a more general purpose.
They talk about an outline not being able to have more than one parent, but I do recall it being possible by adding a reference in the database, even if there’s no UI for it (maybe not in the post-Drupal 8 incarnation of the software, but definitely in a previous version).

item.description: @rtanglao I procrastinate about everything else, but the prospect of Singaporean-Malaysian food in Toronto, and close by, no less, had me leaping out of my seat!
item.source:markdown: @rtanglao I procrastinate about everything else, but the prospect of Singaporean-Malaysian food in Toronto, and close by, no less, had me leaping out of my seat!

item.description: @rtanglao I went to Stackt Market, where their website said they were, on February 6th, and it was nowhere to be found. I assume the January COVID restrictions did them in.
item.source:markdown: @rtanglao I went to Stackt Market, where their website said they were, on February 6th, and it was nowhere to be found. I assume the January COVID restrictions did them in.

item.description: @rtanglao Update: By the time I got there, it was gone.
item.source:markdown: @rtanglao Update: By the time I got there, it was gone.

item.description:
Toronto isn’t quite in “you have to vote with your feet” (i.e. you have to move somewhere where this is already in place to have it) territory, I don’t think, because there are parts of town where the situation is improving. It’s still not great. https://t.co/xcM64G2VEz

Case in point, this newly redeveloped park: https://t.co/55JUcTwiOW
item.source:markdown:
Toronto isn’t quite in “you have to vote with your feet” (i.e. you have to move somewhere where this is already in place to have it) territory, I don’t think, because there are parts of town where the situation is improving. It’s still not great. https://t.co/xcM64G2VEz
Case in point, this newly redeveloped park: https://t.co/55JUcTwiOW

item.description:
Do you feel like all of the possible opinions about something have been expressed by the time you get to a news item?

We’re living in an era where somebody else has already been the first to express their feelings about something, and all you can do is press the 👍🏻 or ❤️ button on it.

As soon as I am about to post “Here’s what I do” on a post that asks a question, someone else has done more less the same thing.

You end up having to wear a Mardi Gras hat and a Colorado Rockies jersey at a Toronto Blue Jays vs. Tampa Bay Rays baseball game in August to stand out these days.
item.source:markdown:
Do you feel like all of the possible opinions about something have been expressed by the time you get to a news item?
We’re living in an era where somebody else has already been the first to express their feelings about something, and all you can do is press the 👍🏻 or ❤️ button on it.
As soon as I am about to post “Here’s what I do” on a post that asks a question, someone else has done more less the same thing.
You end up having to wear a Mardi Gras hat and a Colorado Rockies jersey at a Toronto Blue Jays vs. Tampa Bay Rays baseball game in August to stand out these days.

item.description:
“In a year that has been so improbable, the impossible has happened.” RIP. https://t.co/RSIaXY2O7t

Vin Scully was someone we gained, not someone we lost.

My favourite Vin Scully quote isn’t even a real Vin Scully quote. https://t.co/Vg2E8Wwhx3
item.source:markdown:

item.description: @Sean_YYZ I started one for my neighborhood association (a tour of the walkways between buildings) and I was floored by how much a joy it was to make.

item.description: StoryMaps is among the best software I’ve ever seen. They’re easy to create (so that you can focus on making the content) and amazing to use. https://t.co/VwpASxBdXU
